intro: Erigeron metrius, commonly known as the slender fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, prairies, and disturbed soils. It features fine, hairy leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Erigeron metrius is often found in the central and western United States, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
